intro: Dyschoriste subquadrangularis, commonly known as the quadrangular dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its square-shaped stems, which give it its common name. The plant features opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are typically clustered in whorls and are usually violet or purple in color. Dyschoriste subquadrangularis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
